summary: This document is a chain of emails from December 2019 between federal prosecutors and a defense attorney, Robert Glassman, coordinating interviews for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling meetings with a key witness (referred to as 'she' or 'your client'), and planning to contact her siblings and mother, who is overseas, as potential witnesses.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney representing a key witness in the SDNY investigation, coordinating meeting times and witness contact permissions with prosecutors.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the SDNY, copied on emails discussing investigation logistics and witness interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the SDNY investigation; prosecutors intend to discuss specific conduct by him and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as someone whose specific conduct prosecutors intend to discuss with the witness.

connections.description: Glassman is the attorney for an unnamed female witness, coordinating her meetings with prosecutors and managing contact with her family.
Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating to schedule witness interviews and coordinate investigation steps.
The witness's mother is identified as a potentially key witness who lives overseas.
The witness has at least one brother; prosecutors plan to contact siblings as part of their investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Key Witness
events.description: Prosecutors and defense attorney Robert Glassman schedule a meeting for Monday, December 16, 2019, at 11:00 a.m. at Glassman's office to interview his client, a key witness.

events.title: Approval to Contact Witness's Family
events.description: Robert Glassman gives prosecutors the 'go ahead' to contact the witness's siblings and mother to schedule interviews.

locations: Los Angeles, CA (Robert Glassman's law office)
Overseas location (where the witness's mother resides)
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the SDNY were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as of late 2019, planning witness interviews for corroboration.
A key female witness, represented by attorney Robert Glassman, was scheduled to provide detailed information on travel and specific conduct by Epstein and Maxwell.
The witness's mother, living overseas, was identified as a 'potentially key witness' in the investigation.
Prosecutorial strategy involved starting interviews with the witness's siblings and mother before a follow-up meeting with the primary witness.
The correspondence shows careful coordination between prosecutors and defense counsel regarding witness contact and interview logistics.
